name: Test / Inspection Performed - Location of works identified
Test / Inspection Performed - HOLD POINT - Effective erosion and sedimentation control measures shall be implemented in accordance C212 - Control of Erosion and Sedimentation

Test / Inspection Performed - Prior to clearing the limits of clearing shall be clearly marked. Unless otherwise directed, the area to be cleared is that required by site regrading works, including the area occupied bt the completed road formation and assosiated draining works and erosion and sedimentation measures.
Test / Inspection Performed - All measures to prevent damage to exisiting underground and overhead utility services.
Test / Inspection Performed - HOLD POINT - Excavation around Tree roots undertaken under the supervision of a Level 5 Arborist
Test / Inspection Performed - The area within the limits of clearing shall be cleared of all vegetation, both living and dead, all minor man-made structures, all rubbish and other materials.
Test / Inspection Performed - Branches of trees overhanging over road formation cut back to within 0.5m of the tree trunk as directed by the Principal.

Test / Inspection Performed - Grubbing carried out to a depth of 0.5m below the natural surface or 1.5m below FSL. Holes remaining after grubbing trees and stumps backfilled with sound material and compacted to at least relative density of the material in the adjacent ground

Test / Inspection Performed - If directed to stockpile mulch, the mulch needs to be derived from crowns of trees and branches having a max dia of 100mm to two orthogonal dimensions not exceeding 75mm and 50mm
Test / Inspection Performed - All cleared material has been legally disposed of.
Test / Inspection Performed - All required documentation is attached
Test / Inspection Performed - All Non-conformances have been raised, recified and closed.
Verifying Documents / Demonstated Evidence Report Checklist (Reference Number) - N/A
Test / Inspection Performed - Location of works identified
Test / Inspection Performed - Topsoil to be removed and stockpiled separately clear of the work area. Removal of the topsoil to a depth quoted on the drawings or as directed by the Superintendent.
Test / Inspection Performed - Hold Point - After stripping topsoil the embankment foundation is to be made available for inspection by the Principal and surveyed

Test / Inspection Performed - Hold Point - Unsuitable material to be excavated and removed and spoiled or reincorporated as directed. After removal of unsuitable the floor of the excavation is to be presented to Superintendent for inspection to determine foundation treatment
Test / Inspection Performed - Placing fill in Embankment
○ 95% Compaction in each layer up to 0.5m from FSL
○ 98% Compaction in each layer from 0.5m to FSL

Test / Inspection Performed - Completed Batters ± 300mm when measured at right angles to the grade line. Tops of embankments to be trimmed +10mm/-40mm parallel to the designed grade line. Allotment filling to be +/-50mm Vertically and Horizontally.

Test / Inspection Performed - Hold Point – Prior to placement of Select Material Zone or Subbase, present the surface to the Principal for deflection testing. CBR value of material directly under SMZ shall be per the drawings.
Test / Inspection Performed - All required documentation is attached
Test / Inspection Performed - All Non-conformances have been raised, recified and closed.
Verifying Documents / Demonstated Evidence Report Checklist (Reference Number) - N/A
Test / Inspection Performed - Location of works identified
Test / Inspection Performed - Hold Point - Material source along with conforming material NATA test certificates has been submitted and approved by the Principal (Material Stockpile Lot)
Test / Inspection Performed - Hold Point – Proof roll of subgrade
○ All QA for underlying layer is conforming, including survey, testing, hold/witness points. Underlying layer moisture content does not exceed 90%.
Test / Inspection Performed - The thickness of each compacted layer shall be neither less than 100mm nor more than 200mm for all pavement layer types, unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent.

Test / Inspection Performed - Each layer of the base and subbase courses shall be uniformly compacted over its entire area and depth to satisfy the requirements of relative compaction set out in Clauses C242.19 and C242.20. A proof rolling test, as set out in Clause C242.28, shall be used for assessing the uniformity and stiffness of compaction during construction.
-	Not less than 100% standrd Compaction
Stage / Frequency - 1 test per 500m2 min 3 test per lot
Test / Inspection Performed - Tolerances do not exceed:
○ Width - Design centreline to edge of pavement shall be neither less than 50mm nor more then 300mm - the average width shall not be less than the specified width.

○ In addition, where kerb and gutter exists or is being constructed, the level of the top of the base course adjacent to the kerb and gutter shall not vary by more than ± 5mm from the lip level of the gutter minus the design thickness of the wearing surface. Deviation in base course does not exceed 12mm over the length of a 3m straight edge – Straight Edge Test Report to be filled out.
Test / Inspection Performed - Hold Point -  Prior to seal carry out a proof roll with the Principal in accordance with RMS T198
Test / Inspection Performed - All required documentation is attached
Test / Inspection Performed - All Non-conformances have been raised, recified and closed.
Verifying Documents / Demonstated Evidence Report Checklist (Reference Number) - N/A
Test / Inspection Performed - Location of works identified
Test / Inspection Performed - Mix of appropriate strength, aggregate size
○ Footpaths, Barriers and Minor Concrete works | 20mpa | 20mm stone
Test / Inspection Performed - HOLD POINT: Steel reinforcement complies with AS1302, AS1303 or AS1304 as appropriate.

Test / Inspection Performed - The subgrade, or subbase to be as per the drawings. The subgrade shall be compacted to provide min.relatibe compaction of 100% for modified compactive effort (Barriers, Driveways and Footpaths).

Test / Inspection Performed - HOLD POINT: Formwork shall be inspected by the certifying engineer and the pacing of reinforcement in the spaces formed, where specified, shall not commence until the formwork is approved by the certifying engineer.
Test / Inspection Performed - HOLD POINT: Reinforcement in each section of the work shall be approved by the certifying engineer before any concrete is deposited in the section.

Test / Inspection Performed - In footpath and driveways unless shown otherwise on the drawings, bituminious fibreboard expansion joints, 15mm in width for the full depth and max distance of 15m and where barrier abuts against gully pits. All unreinforced paving provided with narrow 20mm vertical grooves contraction in a neat regular patten to form "slabs" no bigger than 2m2. The ratio of the longest side to the shortest side shall not exceed 1.6
Test / Inspection Performed - Concrete compressive strength (testing)

Test / Inspection Performed - HOLD POINT: Placing of concrete shall not commence until the re-inforcement, where specified, has been accepted by the certifying engineer, and all dirt, chips, hardened concrete, mortar and all foreign matter removed from the forms.
Test / Inspection Performed - The freshly placed concrete compacted by continuous spading, slicing or by vibrator units.
○ Exposed surfaces of the concrete shall be struck off and finished with a wooden float. Corners and edges should be as per the drawings.  Surfaces other than Wearing Surfaces:
○ Finally dressed by a wooden float to form an even surface. All future contact surfaces have the coarse aggregate at the surface firmly embedded.
○ Final dressing with a wooden template or float, or by belting. The departure from grade doesn’t exceed 5mm in any 3m length.

Test / Inspection Performed - Two pairs of test specimens shall be moulded for each 15 cubic metres of concrete, or part thereof, one pair being intended for the 7-day test if required and the other pair for a 28-day test.

Test / Inspection Performed - All exposed surfaces of the freshly placed concrete shall be kept moist in accordance with AS 3799, for a minimum period of 3 days. Curing for concrete shall generally be in accordance with the appropriate surface exposure classification in AS 3600.

Test / Inspection Performed - All forms shall remain in place for min. 48 hrs for gully pits, and similar drainage structures, Footpaths, driveways and similar. No superimposed load until the concrete has reached at least 70% of the design strength.
Test / Inspection Performed - Formed concrete surfaces shall have finishes in accordance with the classes of surface finish in AS 3610 as follows:
Test / Inspection Performed - Backfilling after the concrete has hardened and not earlier than three days after placing.

○ Selected backfill consisting of granular material, free from clay and stone larger than 50mm gauge shall be placed against retaining wall and cast-in-place box culverts for a horizontal distance of 1/3 of the height of wall. Selected fill to have, 2<PI<12 when tested in accordance with AS 1289.3.3.1. Max layer of 150mm and the layer to achieve min. MDD of 92%.
Test / Inspection Performed - All required documentation is attached
Test / Inspection Performed - All Non-conformances have been raised, recified and closed.
Verifying Documents / Demonstated Evidence Report Checklist (Reference Number) - N/A
